refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: chafa is a small utility that converts all kinds of images, including animated image formats like GIFs, into (potentially animated) ANSI/Unicode character output that can be displayed in a terminal.
You can specify one or more input files, but the default behavior is slightly different with multiple files -- for instance, animation time will be limited.

listitem.para: Background color of display (color name or hex).
Clear screen before processing each file.
Set output color mode; one of [none, 2, 16, 240, 256, full]. Defaults to full (24-bit).
Color space used for quantization; one of [rgb, din99d]. Defaults to rgb, which is faster but less accurate.
Foreground color of display (color name or hex).
Target font's width/height ratio. Can be specified as a real number or a fraction. Defaults to 1/2.
Invert video. For display with bright backgrounds in color modes 2 and none. Swaps --fg and --bg.
Image preprocessing [on, off]. Defaults to on with 16 colors or lower, off otherwise.
Desired quality [1-9]. 1 is the fastest, 9 is the most accurate. Defaults to 5.
Set maximum output dimensions in columns and rows. By default this will be the size of your terminal, or 80x25 if size detection fails.
Stretch image to fit output dimensions; ignore aspect.
Specify character symbols to employ in final output. See below for full usage and a list of symbol classes.
Threshold above which full transparency will be used [0.0 - 1.0].

refsect1.title: Symbols
refsect1.para: Accepted classes for --symbols are [all, none, space, solid, stipple, block, border, diagonal, dot, quad, half, hhalf, vhalf, inverted]. Some symbols belong to multiple classes, e.g. diagonals are also borders.
You can specify a list of classes separated by commas, or prefix them with + and - to add or remove symbols relative to the existing set. The ordering is significant.
The default symbol set is all-stipple-inverted for all modes except for "none", which looks best when allowed to use inverted characters.
